result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Lamar McDuffie

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie appeared by video, in custody.  
Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Justin Lamar McDuffie.  
Attorney Stephan Nolten for  Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing.
Defendant produced from Stanley  Correctional Institution.
Court is in trial. Defense do not consent to a spin court and request an adjournment.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Case calendared for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Defense Counsel in trial in a different court and unavailable, 
Per email defendant has been transferred to Stanley Correctional Institution.  
New date selected with the parties via email. Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Court unable to hear case on today's date, May 18th, 2022, due to court congestion. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court.  Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense received a new offer from the state she is requesting  an adjournment to review the offer with her client.  The court grants defense request.  The matter is adjourned back to Branch 45 in person.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Violation Report dated February 21, 2022 - received

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for LEVEL 5 Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  
The NO CONTACT ORDER REMAINS IN EFFECT.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court, defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie not in court, in custody appearance waived.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail hearing.    Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court modifies bail to $2,500.00 Signature Bond. Court GRANTS defense's motion to modify bail. 
All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Case adjourned to Branch 45 in person for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. exp. 5/3

Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF3690. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer M. Wierzchowski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense requests a bail review; next date provided by the clerk in Br. 45.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No Contact order signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Justin Lamar McDuffie
Current: 4753 N 54th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 01-23-2022)
Prior: 5107 West Stark Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with GG and IM.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Justin Lamar McDuffie in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin Lamar McDuffie appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
